metadata.title: CVE-2017-14431 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory leak in Xen 3.3 through 4.8.x allows guest OS users to cause adenial of service (ARM or x86 AMD host OS memory consumption) bycontinually rebooting, because certain cleanup is skipped if nopass-through device was ever assigned, aka XSA-207.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14431` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11').
